item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

the update command does that?
the restart command just doesn’t show the countdown, just use the update one.

item.title: Command Help
item.dc:creator: @zoomer zoomer
item.description:
@zoomer wrote:

imsuperman05:

So you want the command to display “Server restart: 30 seconds,” and at 0 second you want it to restart for you?

That’s what he is probably meaning.

item.title: Command Help
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Hey guys, I wanted to pretty much combine two codes, but everytime I try I get an error. /:

Basis of what I am trying to do: I want to make a ::restart command that says, “Server restart: 30 seconds” like the ::update command.

Here is my Restart code:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("restart") && (c.playerRights >= 3)) { for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if(p == null) continue; PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p); } System.exit(0); }

if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("jordan")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a; PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

Read full topic
